subject: Investing
title: Market Orders vs. Limit Orders
description: A 60-second lesson on Market Orders vs. Limit Orders.

hook.text: You click 'buy' and get the stock at a price you didn't expect. A market order takes whatever is available.

buildup.text: A market order fills instantly at the current best price. Fast, but you don't control the exact price.

discovery.text: A limit order lets you set the maximum price you'll pay. It only fills if the market reaches your price.

twist.text: Limit orders can sit unfilled for days. If the stock never drops to your price, you miss the trade.

climax.text: For large or thinly traded stocks, market orders can cause slippage of 1% or more. Limits protect you.

punchline.text: Market orders value speed. Limit orders value precision. Know which you need.

quiz.question: What is the main advantage of a limit order over a market order?
